alert.note: Alert for Cuyahoga; Geauga; Lake; Portage; Summit (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:46AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Portage, Geauga, eastern Cuyahoga, Lake and northern Summit Counties through 530 AM EDT... At 446 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Willowick to near Solon to Cuyahoga Falls. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cleveland, Akron, Painesville, Willowick, Ravenna, Chardon, Fairport Harbor, Cuyahoga Falls, Euclid, Mentor, Cleveland Heights, Kent, Solon, Willoughby, Hudson, Twinsburg, Eastlake, Tallmadge, Streetsboro and Warrensville Heights. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for northeastern Ohio.
